head.supplied: Thursday. ¶ ¶ I feel sure, dear Mr Shillinglaw, that you will publish nothing in the "men of the times" ¶ without giving me a chance of seeing what you said. In my undeservedly painful position part...

div.p: Box 244/3, Shillinglaw papers, La Trobe Australian manuscripts collection, State Library of Victoria, Melbourne.

To proof.
Thursday.
Letter clearly antedates M to J. Shillinglaw, 28 September 1877 on the same subject and, if M's reference to a note in the Herald has been correctly identified (see n. 5), was written after 4 September.

I feel sure, dear Mr Shillinglaw, that you will publish nothing in the "men of the times"
Shillinglaw was assembling material for Men of the time in Australia: Victorian series (Melbourne, 1878), in which an entry on M appeared on p. 138. without giving me a chance of seeing what you said. In my undeservedly painful position particularly care should be taken in biographic notes concerning me.

div.p: In my distress and oppression, dear Mr Shillinglaw, I have quite an aversion to parade in the "men of the times". — It would be a parody of my former celebrity! Let me remain also thus far remain in oblivion, until a sound Statesmanship and an intelligent journalism supports my reinstatement or at least an honorable reestablishment of my Department. Anything that would appear in your book about me, would only be ridiculed & distorted by some leading men of the Melbourne press, with their usual meanness towards me!

In the newest edition of the English work "men of the times", some kind friends have contributed notes about me, which at the whole are fair & correct.
Men of the time (London, 1875), pp. 744-5. If you absolutely must include one, now so disregarded & humiliatingly set aside, then make use of that article and if you call any Sunday or Saturday afternoon I may add a few trifling additions.

div.p:
I suppose your kind note in the Herald was refused at the Argus.
M may be referring to notes on several geographical subjects, including Ernest Giles's election on M's recommendation as an Honorary Fellow of the 'Imperial Geographical Societies of Vienna and Italy', that were published in the Melbourne Herald, 4 September 1877, p. 3.
